pro_specifications.purpose:
Extracts patient-reported outcome (PRO) and clinical outcome assessment (COA)
    specifications including instruments, ePRO system configuration, and compliance
    requirements. Essential for ePRO/eCOA vendor configuration.
pro_specifications.scope:
- PRO instruments (questionnaires, scales)
    - ePRO/eCOA system configuration
    - ClinRO instruments (clinician-rated)
    - ObsRO instruments (observer-rated)
    - PerfO instruments (performance outcomes)
    - Daily diaries
    - Administration timing and windows
    - Compliance thresholds
    - Scoring and MCID definitions

keyInsights.name: PRO Instruments
keyInsights.description: Questionnaires with administration mode, timing, scoring

keyInsights.name: ePRO System Configuration
keyInsights.description: Vendor, platform, alerts, reminders, compliance thresholds

keyInsights.name: Assessment Schedule
keyInsights.description: Timepoints, windows, recall periods for each instrument

automationUseCases: Set up compliance monitoring and alerts
pro_specifications.regulatoryRelevance: FDA PRO Guidance, ICH M11 Section 7.4

arms_design.purpose:
Extracts the complete treatment design including study arms, epochs, dosing regimens,
    randomization configuration, and drug supply requirements. This is the primary source
    for IRT/IWRS and drug supply management system configuration.
arms_design.scope:
- Study arms (experimental, comparator, placebo)
    - Treatment epochs (screening, treatment, follow-up)
    - Study cells (arm × epoch matrix)
    - Dosing regimens (dose, frequency, route, cycle length)
    - Dose modification rules and triggers
    - Randomization details (ratio, stratification, block size, algorithm)
    - Drug supply kit configurations

keyInsights.name: Study Arms
keyInsights.description: Complete arm definitions with interventions, types, and allocation ratios

keyInsights.name: Dosing Regimens
keyInsights.description: Dose, unit, frequency, route, cycle length, dose calculation basis

keyInsights.name: Stratification Factors
keyInsights.description: Randomization stratification with levels and definitions

keyInsights.name: Dose Modification Rules
keyInsights.description: Reduction levels, triggers, hold/resume criteria

keyInsights.name: Drug Supply Configuration
keyInsights.description: Kit types, dispensing schedule, supply model

automationUseCases: Auto-generate IRT randomization and drug dispensing configuration
Create EDC treatment assignment and dose modification CRFs
Generate pharmacy manuals and dispensing instructions
Set up stratification factor data entry forms

withdrawal_procedures.purpose:
Extracts study discontinuation procedures including types of withdrawal, required
    assessments, and follow-up requirements. Important for EDC disposition forms and
    protocol deviation tracking.
withdrawal_procedures.scope:
- Discontinuation types (treatment vs study)
    - Consent withdrawal procedures
    - Early termination visit requirements
    - Survival follow-up
    - Lost to follow-up procedures
    - Protocol deviation handling

keyInsights.name: Discontinuation Types
keyInsights.description: Treatment vs study discontinuation with criteria

keyInsights.name: Follow-up Requirements
keyInsights.description: Post-discontinuation follow-up procedures

automationUseCases: Create EDC disposition and early termination forms

safety_decision_points.purpose:
Extracts actionable safety decision rules including dose modification triggers,
    study stopping rules, and organ-specific adjustments. These translate directly
    into EDC edit checks and medical monitor alert configurations.
safety_decision_points.scope:
- Safety parameter categories discovered in protocol
    - Decision points with conditions and actions
    - Dose modification levels (reduction percentages, absolute doses)
    - Re-escalation criteria
    - Study stopping rules (individual and aggregate)
    - Organ-specific dose adjustments (hepatic, renal, cardiac)
    - Recovery/rechallenge criteria

keyInsights.name: Dose Reduction Levels
keyInsights.description: Defined dose levels (-1, -2, etc.) with absolute or percentage reductions

keyInsights.name: Decision Rules
keyInsights.description: If-then rules mapping safety findings to required actions

keyInsights.name: Stopping Rules
keyInsights.description: Individual and study-level stopping conditions

keyInsights.name: Organ-Specific Adjustments
keyInsights.description: Hepatic, renal, cardiac, hematologic dose adjustments

automationUseCases: Generate EDC edit checks for dose modification triggers
Configure IRT dose assignment validation rules
Set up medical monitor safety alert thresholds
Create dose modification decision trees for site training

laboratory_specifications.purpose:
Extracts laboratory panel definitions, normal ranges, eligibility-related lab
    criteria, and lab-triggered dose modifications. Critical for central lab setup
    and EDC lab data entry configuration.
laboratory_specifications.scope:
- Laboratory panels (hematology, chemistry, urinalysis, etc.)
    - Individual tests with units and methods
    - Eligibility-related lab criteria
    - Lab-triggered dose modifications
    - Hepatotoxicity monitoring (Hy's Law)
    - Central vs local lab requirements
    - Special lab tests (biomarkers, pharmacogenomics)

keyInsights.name: Laboratory Panels
keyInsights.description: Panel definitions with constituent tests

keyInsights.name: Eligibility Lab Criteria
keyInsights.description: Lab values required for study entry

keyInsights.name: Lab-Triggered Actions
keyInsights.description: Lab thresholds triggering dose holds/modifications

automationUseCases: Set up EDC lab data entry with units and ranges
Configure lab alert thresholds in EDC

site_operations_logistics.purpose:
Extracts site operational requirements including equipment, training, drug supply,
    and vendor coordination. Supports site initiation planning and CTMS configuration.
site_operations_logistics.scope:
- Site equipment requirements
    - Training requirements
    - Drug storage and handling
    - IP accountability procedures
    - Vendor coordination
    - Site qualification criteria
    - Document requirements

keyInsights.name: Equipment Requirements
keyInsights.description: Site equipment needs for assessments

keyInsights.name: Training Requirements
keyInsights.description: Required site training modules

endpoints_estimands_sap.purpose:
Extracts study objectives, endpoints, estimands (per ICH E9 R1), analysis populations,
    and statistical analysis specifications. This is the definitive source for programming
    analysis datasets and statistical outputs.
endpoints_estimands_sap.scope:
- Primary, secondary, and exploratory objectives
    - Endpoint definitions with outcome types and assessment methods
    - ICH E9(R1) compliant estimands with intercurrent event strategies
    - Analysis populations (ITT, mITT, PP, Safety)
    - Sensitivity and subgroup analyses
    - Multiplicity adjustment strategy
    - Missing data handling

keyInsights.name: Primary Endpoints
keyInsights.description: Primary efficacy endpoints with outcome type, timepoints, and assessment method

keyInsights.name: Estimands
keyInsights.description: ICH E9(R1) estimands with treatment comparison, population, variable, ICE strategies

keyInsights.name: Analysis Populations
keyInsights.description: ITT, mITT, PP, Safety population definitions with inclusion/exclusion criteria

keyInsights.name: Statistical Methods
keyInsights.description: Model specifications, covariates, multiplicity adjustment

keyInsights.name: Subgroup Analyses
keyInsights.description: Pre-specified subgroup definitions and analysis methods

automationUseCases: Generate CDISC ADaM dataset specifications from estimands
Auto-create TLF shells from endpoint definitions
Generate SAP templates with population definitions
Create endpoint assessment CRFs in EDC
endpoints_estimands_sap.regulatoryRelevance: ICH E9(R1), ICH M11 Sections 2-3, CTD Module 2.7.3/2.7.6

pkpd_sampling.purpose:
Extracts pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic sampling specifications including
    timepoints, bioanalytical methods, and population PK requirements. Essential for
    clinical pharmacology studies and bioanalytical lab setup.
pkpd_sampling.scope:
- PK sampling timepoints (intensive, sparse)
    - PD biomarker sampling
    - Bioanalytical methods and assay validation
    - Population PK specifications
    - Drug concentration thresholds
    - Sample handling for PK

keyInsights.name: PK Sampling Schedule
keyInsights.description: Intensive and sparse PK timepoints

keyInsights.name: Bioanalytical Methods
keyInsights.description: Assay methods, LLOQ, validated ranges

automationUseCases: Set up PK timepoint tracking in EDC

quality_management.purpose:
Extracts quality management specifications including monitoring approach (RBQM),
    KRIs, quality tolerance limits, and audit procedures. Essential for CTMS monitoring
    configuration.
quality_management.scope:
- Monitoring approach (on-site, remote, centralized)
    - Risk-based quality management (RBQM)
    - Key Risk Indicators (KRIs)
    - Quality Tolerance Limits (QTLs)
    - Source data verification extent
    - Audit procedures
    - CAPA management

keyInsights.name: Monitoring Approach
keyInsights.description: On-site, remote, centralized monitoring strategy

keyInsights.name: Key Risk Indicators
keyInsights.description: KRIs with thresholds and escalation procedures

keyInsights.name: Quality Tolerance Limits
keyInsights.description: QTLs with actions when exceeded

automationUseCases: Set up KRI dashboards and thresholds

adverse_events.purpose:
Extracts comprehensive adverse event management specifications including AE/SAE definitions,
    grading systems, causality assessment, reporting timelines, and AESI lists. Critical for
    safety database configuration and pharmacovigilance workflows.
adverse_events.scope:
- AE and TEAE definitions
    - SAE criteria per ICH E2A
    - CTCAE grading system version and definitions
    - Causality assessment methodology
    - MedDRA coding specifications
    - Reporting timelines (routine AE, SAE, SUSAR, pregnancy)
    - AESI list with special monitoring requirements
    - DLT criteria (oncology protocols)
    - Safety committees (DSMB, SMC)

keyInsights.name: AE Collection Period
keyInsights.description: When AE collection starts and ends relative to study drug

keyInsights.name: SAE Criteria
keyInsights.description: ICH E2A serious criteria with protocol-specific exceptions

keyInsights.name: Reporting Timelines
keyInsights.description: Hours/days for initial SAE report, follow-up, SUSAR

keyInsights.name: AESI List
keyInsights.description: Adverse events of special interest with monitoring requirements

keyInsights.name: DLT Criteria
keyInsights.description: Dose-limiting toxicity definitions, observation period, MTD rules

automationUseCases: Configure safety database with protocol-specific SAE criteria
Set up expedited reporting workflows and timelines
Create EDC AE/SAE CRFs with proper grading dropdowns
Configure AESI flag logic in safety database
Generate site training materials on AE reporting
Set up DLT tracking dashboards for dose escalation
adverse_events.regulatoryRelevance: ICH E2A, ICH E6(R2), ICH M11 Section 8

data_management.purpose:
Extracts data management specifications including EDC configuration, CDISC standards,
    data quality requirements, and database lock procedures. Guides EDC setup and
    data management planning.
data_management.scope:
- EDC system requirements
    - CDISC standards (CDASH, SDTM, ADaM versions)
    - Data entry timelines
    - Query management
    - Database lock procedures
    - Source data verification requirements
    - Data transfer specifications

keyInsights.name: EDC Requirements
keyInsights.description: EDC system specifications, vendor requirements

keyInsights.name: CDISC Standards
keyInsights.description: Required CDASH, SDTM, ADaM versions

keyInsights.name: Data Entry Timelines
keyInsights.description: Expected data entry windows after visit

automationUseCases: Configure EDC data entry timelines and alerts
Set up CDISC standards compliance checks

biospecimen_handling.purpose:
Extracts specimen collection, processing, storage, and shipping requirements.
    Essential for central lab setup, biobank configuration, and site laboratory
    manual generation.
biospecimen_handling.scope:
- Specimen types and collection requirements
    - Tube types, volumes, and handling
    - Processing instructions (centrifugation, aliquoting)
    - Storage conditions (temperature, duration)
    - Shipping requirements (courier, temperature monitoring)
    - Central lab vs local lab procedures
    - Biobanking/future research samples

keyInsights.name: Specimen Collection Requirements
keyInsights.description: Tubes, volumes, special handling for each sample type

keyInsights.name: Processing Instructions
keyInsights.description: Centrifugation, aliquoting, timing requirements

keyInsights.name: Shipping Requirements
keyInsights.description: Temperature, courier, documentation for specimen transport

automationUseCases: Generate central lab sample collection kits
Set up shipping logistics and temperature monitoring

study_metadata.purpose:
Extracts foundational study-level metadata that all other agents depend on.
    This agent runs first and provides the context (protocol ID, phase, therapeutic area,
    population characteristics) that enables accurate extraction by downstream agents.
study_metadata.scope:
- Protocol identification (NCT, EudraCT, IND numbers)
    - Study phase, type, and design overview
    - Sponsor information
    - Target population characteristics (disease, age, sex, biomarkers)
    - Key milestones and timelines
    - Design metadata (randomization, blinding, enrollment targets)

keyInsights.name: Protocol Identifiers
keyInsights.description: NCT number, EudraCT, IND numbers for regulatory cross-referencing

keyInsights.name: Study Phase
keyInsights.description: Clinical trial phase with NCI Thesaurus code

keyInsights.name: Target Population
keyInsights.description: Disease, age range, sex, biomarker requirements, performance status

keyInsights.name: Study Milestones
keyInsights.description: Screening period, enrollment duration, treatment duration, follow-up

keyInsights.name: Design Metadata
keyInsights.description: Randomization ratio, blinding type, target enrollment, countries

automationUseCases: Pre-populate EDC study header and demographics forms
Configure CTMS study record with identifiers and milestones
Set IRT enrollment caps by country/region
study_metadata.regulatoryRelevance: Foundation for ICH M11 sections 1-5, CTD Module 5

imaging_central_reading.purpose:
Extracts imaging specifications including response criteria (RECIST, RANO),
    imaging modalities, central reading requirements, and adjudication procedures.
    Essential for oncology and imaging-endpoint studies.
imaging_central_reading.scope:
- Response assessment criteria (RECIST 1.1, iRECIST, RANO)
    - Imaging modalities and protocols
    - Central vs local reading
    - Reader blinding
    - Adjudication procedures
    - Image acquisition specifications
    - Timepoints and windows

keyInsights.name: Response Criteria
keyInsights.description: RECIST/iRECIST/RANO version and modifications

keyInsights.name: Imaging Schedule
keyInsights.description: Tumor assessment timepoints and windows

keyInsights.name: Central Reading
keyInsights.description: Independent central review configuration

imaging_central_reading.regulatoryRelevance: FDA Oncology Guidance, ICH M11 Section 7

concomitant_medications.purpose:
Extracts medication restrictions, drug interactions, washout requirements, and required
    premedications. Essential for site guidance, eligibility verification, and drug
    interaction checking in EDC.
concomitant_medications.scope:
- Prohibited medications (with reasons and periods)
    - Restricted medications (with conditions for use)
    - Required premedications and prophylaxis
    - Rescue medications
    - Washout requirements
    - Drug-drug interactions (CYP450, QT, etc.)
    - Vaccine policy
    - Herbal/supplement restrictions

keyInsights.name: Prohibited Medications
keyInsights.description: Completely banned drug classes with prohibition reasons and periods

keyInsights.name: Washout Requirements
keyInsights.description: Required washout periods before study entry

keyInsights.name: Drug Interactions
keyInsights.description: CYP450 inhibitors/inducers, QT prolonging agents with management

keyInsights.name: Required Premedications
keyInsights.description: Mandatory premedications with dosing and timing

Generate site reference cards for prohibited/restricted meds
Create eligibility screening tools with washout calculators
Set up drug interaction alerts in safety database
Auto-populate premedication requirements in visit forms

informed_consent.purpose:
Extracts key informed consent content elements including study risks, benefits,
    alternatives, and special consent requirements. Supports ICF template generation
    and IRB submission preparation.
informed_consent.scope:
- Key risks (common, serious, unknown)
    - Potential benefits
    - Treatment alternatives
    - Compensation and costs
    - Confidentiality provisions
    - Genetic/biobanking consent elements
    - Optional sub-study consents
    - Witness requirements

keyInsights.name: Key Risks
keyInsights.description: Common, serious, and unknown risks to communicate

keyInsights.name: Optional Consents
keyInsights.description: Biobanking, genetic testing, future research options
